body:
Hello, if you read my earlier post you will see that I am working on a Avicus Nebula Map. I have the basic shell created, but as I was creating it I had a question that I just couldn't let go.

Question: What would you say is the "Preferred"  length & width for a nebula map?

 I know I asked this before, however I didn't get a specific answer and I just want to make sure that I for sure don't make it too small.

Thanks so much guys! Bye Bye for now!
body_tagged:

Thanks so much guys! Bye Bye for now!
title: I'm back with some more map questions!

replies.body:
I'd go big or go home.

Dont make the map to small, because there are limits. But really you can expand the map so a size ranging from maybe 200x100 to 500x500.

Thats just what I think will make the best map and still give you working room.
replies.body_tagged:
I'd go big or go home.

Dont make the map to small, because there are limits. But really you can expand the map so a size ranging from maybe 200x100 to 500x500.

Thats just what I think will make the best map and still give you working room.

replies.body: Okay thank so much! My map currently is 250x150. I will expand this more knowing the information I do know.
replies.body_tagged: Okay thank so much! My map currently is 250x150. I will expand this more knowing the information I do know.

replies.body: Look at my nebula map post, and see what maps the people love. Take account of those map sizes and game-play - It may help you make the best map yet, the only thing that post can do is lead you in the correct direction. :)
replies.body_tagged: Look at my nebula map post, and see what maps the people love. Take account of those map sizes and game-play - It may help you make the best map yet, the only thing that post can do is lead you in the correct direction. :)

replies.body:
Well, any size is good! It depends in what you're going to build anyways.
As long as the map isn't excessively big or excessively small, it's fine :)
replies.body_tagged:

replies.body: Alright! Thanks so much for the info.
